movesets.name: Choice Scarf

items.name: Choice Scarf
items.description: Hold item which raises Speed by 50%, but locks holder into one move.

movesets.description:
Moves

U-turn is the best part of the set, allowing Bunnelby to scout the opposing team and wear down its checks and counters. Return is the next best part because it's super strong and is backed by STAB. Earthquake covers Steel- and Rock-types. Quick Attack lets you pick off faster enemies at low health, including Chlorophyll sweepers in the sun and Speed Boost Carvanha. Thief covers Gastly and Drifloon, and it can allow Bunnelby to steal an opponent's item after taking a weaker Knock Off.

Set Details

The given EVs maximize Bunnelby's sweeping capabilities, with the remainder put in Defense to better take priority attacks. A Choice Scarf is used to outspeed the entire unboosted metagame. An Adamant nature is enough to achieve this, but Jolly can be used to outspeed +1 Jolly Scraggy and +2 Adamant Tirtouga as well.

Usage Tips

Bunnelby can function as a speedy scout, a revenge killer, and a late-game cleaner all in one. You can honestly use it for any or all of the above roles in any given game, so how you play it will depend a lot on the rest of your team and the opponent's team. It makes for a nice lead because of its fast U-turn, but this also causes you to give away your set most of the time.

Team Options

Bunnelby fits on all kinds of teams because of how many roles it can perform. Bunnelby appreciates a check to Fighting-types, like Fletchling. Having more wallbreakers on your team will also help Bunnelby sweep.

movesets.name: Life Orb

items.name: Life Orb
items.description: Boosts power by 30%, user takes 10% recoil each turn it attacks.

movesets.description:
Moves

Return is Bunnelby's best STAB move, which hits most of the tier for neutral damage. Quick Attack is what makes Bunnelby such a scary Pokemon; when it can't outspeed the opposing Pokemon, it has a priority attack that can still do massive damage or even get a KO. For example, even a Jolly Quick Attack is powerful enough to OHKO standard Carvanha. Thanks to U-turn, Bunnelby can come in against slower Pokemon it can force out and get huge damage off on incoming switches without being hurt in the process. Earthquake provides coverage against Steel-types, including Magnemite, Ferroseed, and Pawniard. It also hits Rock- and Ghost-type Pokemon, though many notable Pokemon of these types, such as Archen and Gastly, are not affected by it. Thief can be used instead in order to hit Gastly, but because it outspeeds Bunnelby, it's difficult to hurt it without being KOed by Sludge Bomb in the process.

Set Details

The EVs on Bunnelby are standard for offensive Pokemon, with an extra point thrown into Defense. 23 HP IVs bring Bunnelby down to 19 HP so that it only loses one point of HP from Life Orb recoil. Life Orb is used for additional power to help it get specific KOs, such as the OHKO against Carvanha with Quick Attack. A Jolly nature is preferred so that Bunnelby can outspeed Berry Juice Magnemite and Defensive Chinchou. On the other hand, an Adamant nature is still a solid alternative for raw power.

Usage Tips

As Bunnelby is first and foremost a wallbreaker, you want to bring it in as much as you can against defensive teams and start attacking. Basically just bring Bunnelby in on anything that will allow a free switch (slow Volt Switch/U-turn, on the revenge, against Honedge when it's obvious that they won't use Secret Sword, etc) and start smacking around the opponent's team. Early game, you're best off going for U-turn most of the time unless the opponent has no counters.

Team Options

Life Orb Bunnelby goes deliciously well with Sticky Web, as it is super strong but a bit lacking in Speed, so Surskit and Spinarak are ideal partners. Bulky pivots are nice because faster offensive threats are going to come in to revenge kill Bunnelby a lot, meaning that Chinchou and Mienfoo are really nice partners. Other U-turn and Volt Switch users are also nice to keep up offensive momentum and help wear down Bunnelby's checks; Magnemite and the aforementioned Chinchou and Mienfoo are cool for this.

moves.name: Agility
moves.description: Boosts Speed by 2 stages.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Bounce
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn. 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Brick Break
moves.description: Destroys Light Screen and Reflect, then hits.

moves.name: Bulk Up
moves.description: Boosts Attack and Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Bulldoze
moves.description: Lowers target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Cut
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Defense Curl
moves.description: Boosts Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dig
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Kick
moves.description: Hits twice in 1 turn.

moves.name: Double Slap
moves.description: Hits 2-5 times in 1 turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Earthquake
moves.description: Hits Pokemon using Dig with double Base Power.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Flail
moves.description: Does more damage as HP decreases.

moves.name: Fling
moves.description: Throws the user's hold item at the foe. Power and effect depend on the item.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Leer
moves.description: Lowers target's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Mud Shot
moves.description: Lowers Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Mud-Slap
moves.description: Lowers accuracy by 1 stage.

moves.name: Nature Power
moves.description: Attack changes based on terrain.

moves.name: Odor Sleuth
moves.description: Blocks evasion modifiers. Allows Fighting- and Normal-type moves to hit Ghosts.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Power-Up Punch
moves.description: Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Quick Attack
moves.description: The user always attacks first.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Rock Slide
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Rock Smash
moves.description: 50% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Rock Tomb
moves.description: Lowers Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Rollout
moves.description: Doubles in power with each hit. Repeats for 5 turns.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Sandstorm
moves.description: Summons a sandstorm for 5 turns.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Sludge Bomb
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Smack Down
moves.description: Can hit if target is using Fly, Bounce, or Sky Drop. Ends target's airborne moves and its benefits from Flying type or Levitate.

moves.name: Spikes
moves.description: Causes damage to the enemy whenever they switch.

moves.name: Stone Edge
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Strength
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Super Fang
moves.description: Does damage equal to half the foe's current HP.

moves.name: Surf
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Tackle
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Take Down
moves.description: Has 1/4 recoil.

moves.name: Thief
moves.description: Steals target's item.

moves.name: Torment
moves.description: Prevents the target from using the same move twice in a row.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: U-turn
moves.description: Attacks, then switches.

moves.name: Wild Charge
moves.description: Has 1/4 recoil.

abilities.name: Cheek Pouch
abilities.description: Increases HP when this Pokemon consumes a berry.

abilities.name: Pickup
abilities.description: If the wielder has no held item, it gets the last item consumed at the end of the turn. Adds a chance of finding an item after each battle.
